revised_title: The Role of Puncture in Plant Virus Transmission by Insect Vectors
tldr: This study investigates the role of puncture in the transmission of plant viruses by insect vectors, specifically Cicadulina mbila Naude. The author found that the ability of an insect to transmit the virus and the susceptibility of the plant to the virus play a significant role in the transmission process. The study also discusses the factors that determine the success or failure of virus transmission and the potential impact of plant susceptibility on the results of experimental trials.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
